section.title: Cron jobs
section.para: A cron job is a scheduled job, to be executed periodically or at a defined time. Each second, the cron thread wakes up and examines all stored crontabs, checking each command to see if it should be run.
Commands are executed without any user context, so it can't be used to interact with connected users. Any output will be stored in the standard log.

NOTE: Cron jobs are executed in a separate thread, sharing its memory with the server. This means that cron jobs must pay attention not to cause classical threads problems (like modifying a linked list used by the server without using mutexes) and not to overwrite the server's memory !
As usual, cron jobs can be internal (functions written in C and added by modules) or external (defined in config file).
